1.text: Decide how much pasta to cook.

2.text: Fill a large pot with cold or cool water.

3.text: Add salt and bring the water to a boil.

4.text: Stir the spaghetti into the boiling water.

5.text: Set a timer for 8 to 11 minutes and stir the noodles frequently.

6.text: Test the spaghetti to see if it's as soft as you like.

7.text: Drain the cooked spaghetti using a colander.

8.text: Top the noodles with your favorite sauce and serve the spaghetti.

9.text: Sauté the onion and garlic over medium-high heat for 5 minutes.

10.text: Add 1 pound (0.45 kg) of ground meat and cook it for 7 to 8 minutes.

11.text: Drain the meat if there's a lot of grease in the pan.

12.text: Stir in and simmer the pasta sauce for 10 minutes.

13.text: Serve the meat sauce over the cooked spaghetti.

14.text: Melt the butter with garlic and red pepper flakes over medium heat.

15.text: Cook and whisk the butter over medium heat for 4 to 5 minutes.

16.text: Turn off the burner and stir in the cooked noodles and cheese.

19.text: Sauté the onion for 5 to 6 minutes.

20.text: Stir in the garlic and red pepper flakes if you're using them.

21.text: Stir in the tomatoes and add salt and pepper to taste.

22.text: Simmer the red sauce over medium-low heat for 30 minutes.

23.text: Tear fresh basil and stir it into the sauce.

24.text: Spoon the red sauce over cooked spaghetti and serve it immediately.
